Great orators in history would not have been recognized as such if their words carried no value. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is neither a great orator, nor did his speech before a joint Congressional session on July 24 have actual worth. It was an expression of his desperation, if not defeat, on all fronts.
This is not new. For years, Netanyahu has served the role of a social media meme. During his United Nations General Assembly speech in September 2012, the Israeli leader displayed a bomb diagram to fan the flames for another Middle East war. More
The post When ‘Prophets’ Become Memes: Rise and Fall of Benjamin Netanyahu appeared first on CounterPunch.org.

It refers to an Old Testament commandment to wipe out all Amalekians for attacking Jews as they left Egypt, and not to spare their children or livestock while destroying everything they owned. More

articles.author: Sarah D. Phillips
articles.description:
I am tired of talking about J.D. Vance. And I’m not one for introspection (just ask my husband). But as a daughter of Appalachia and a professor of anthropology at a public university, J.D. Vance’s claim to represent Appalachia and his threats to attack our nation’s universities and their professors, who he’s labeled “the enemy,” are personal for me. Echoing other Appalachia-raised writers who have recently weighed in, I say to J.D. Vance: you are a hillbilly phony (Caleb Miller). You don’t represent us (Neema Avashia). And you can keep your “elegy” (Ivy Brashear) because hillbillies don’t need one (Meredith McCarroll). Your Hillbilly Elegy is a political platform disguised as a memoir, and I call bullshit. More
The post A Mountaineer’s Prayer appeared first on CounterPunch.org.
articles.title: A Mountaineer’s Prayer

articles.author: Jeffrey St. Clair
articles.description:
Deputy Sean Grayson didn’t turn on his body camera until after he’d shot Sonya Massey three times. This is probably why he thought he could get away with saying he killed Massey in self-defense, as she was charging toward him with a pot of boiling water. What Grayson didn’t realize is that his partner’s body cam recorded the entire fatal encounter, showing that the diminutive, unarmed Massey was hiding from the Springfield deputy, when Grayson walked around the kitchen counter, shot her in the face and left her to bleed out. Then he lied about it…lies that were caught on tape and exposed as lies on tape. More
The post “I’ll Fucking Shoot You in the Face”: the Police Murder of Sonya Massey appeared first on CounterPunch.org.
articles.title: “I’ll Fucking Shoot You in the Face”: the Police Murder of Sonya Massey

articles.author: Eve Ottenberg
articles.description:
The earth gets hotter, as rich nations continue their coal, oil and gas burning spree, while those who urge a course correction get…thrown into prison. The latest casualty of a judiciary dedicated to preserving ecocidal plutocracy is Extinction Rebellion’s Roger Hallam, sentenced to five years in jail in the U.K. for his efforts to stop the corporate insanity defiling the planet. You may think “defiling” is a strong word. But with a heat index of 144 degrees Fahrenheit in Dubai July 16, multiple heat domes baking enormous swaths of the globe this month at record-smashing temperatures for record-smashing lengths of time, and the four hottest days IN A ROW ever recorded in July, you might want to thank Hallam for attempting to arrest this calamity. More
The post Living With Heat appeared first on CounterPunch.org.
articles.title: Living With Heat

articles.author: Pablo D. Azar, Adrian G. Casillas, and Maryam Farboodi
articles.description: Decentralized Finance, or DeFi, is a rapidly growing ecosystem of financial applications built on blockchain technology, primarily on the Ethereum network. These applications aim to recreate traditional financial instruments and services, such as lending, borrowing, trading, and insurance. The DeFi intermediation chain connects a series of intermediaries who find arbitrage opportunities, aggregate transactions into blocks, validate these blocks, and ultimately append them to the blockchain. In this post, we summarize results from our staff report describing how arbitrage opportunities arise in the Ethereum blockchain, and how the need to keep these arbitrage opportunities private gives rise to the intermediation chain.
articles.title: The DeFi Intermediation Chain

articles.description:
If you've been into running a blog or personal site very long, it's safe to say you've heard the terms "IndieWeb" or "small web" thrown around. I've only been into this stuff for a few months at this point but my understanding of what that actually means has already matured and evolved a lot.
Really, any personal website you use (instead of corporate social media) for your online presence is part of the IndieWeb. It's like independent music. You're writing, recording and distributing all on your own rather than finding a manager, record label, big name recording studio and getting wrapped up in contracts.
It's pretty punk, actually. Running your own corner of the internet is like recording an album in your bedroom and then selling it at the shows you independently worked with bars and venu…
articles.title: What is the IndieWeb even?

articles.description:
In my first Blaugust post, I insinuated that I had a plan on how I’m going to tackle this month’s blogging challenge.
I'll make a plan (of some sort) of how I'm going to tackle this at some point.
The truth is, my plan going into this is to not have a plan.
I joined the IndieWeb blogging community at the very tail end of March. In April, I joined a daily photo challenge hosted by Micro.blog. It was my very first challenge and had no idea what to expect. I enjoyed posting a photo a day alongside a community based on a specific prompt. I felt that sort of camraderie feeling amongst a blogging community I haven’t felt in a very long time.
That one was easy. I didn’t stress out about it because photos tend to come easier to me than words. I had a collection of photos I could dig into to meet t…
articles.title: The Plan to Not Have a Plan

articles.description:
I came across this concept reading a book with the same name as the title of this post. The author makes the argument that we have been led astray by the passion hypothesis. Passion is fickle and hard to define in some cases. What we really want is freedom and autonomy in the work we do. A sense of ownership and a feeling of contribution.
But there is no free lunch. You want rainbows and unicorns at work but what do you bring in exchange? You bring a skillset. Something you are so godamn good in that they can't help but hire you. Can't help but give you freedom, autonomy, and ownership. The ability to set your own hours and work on the things you like.
This is even more relevant when you are building a product. The typical indie hacking advice is to iterate fast and throw a bunch of things at the wall. See what sticks. Probably good advice to make some money but always felt like a pussy move to me. What you make is determined by the whims and fancies of the initial audience.
What happened to being that intense 'Steve Job' type of founder? YOU believe in the product with such fervor that DAMN the market. They will buy it and they will like it. You have a vision. And the habits of the people and the market will change to serve it.
It goes beyond just being so good that you cannot be ignored. No. This is a different level. You don't just move through the world, the world moves to accommodate your passing.
articles.title: So good, they can't ignore you

articles.description:
The summer term is over! I'm back in my hometown, bothering my dogs and following my grandmother around the house like a little kid. I was hoping to get 100s all around this term, but I messed up one arts assignment, so I'm afraid I'll have to settle for almost there. I'll need all the tiny boosts I can get from electives if I want to graduate on time and with honors in two years. Agh.
School aside, there's nothing much to write about today. The sky's been cloudy but bright the whole day, like the sun is playing hide-and-seek with the intention of being found. I ate banana bread and another unidentified sweet bread someone brought back from a trip. The banana bread was okay, but the other one (milk? Butter? Just normal sugary bread?) was really good. Thank God for bread.
I'm starting and abandoning so many new posts. I couldn't settle on any of them, so I decided to do this one instead. Hope you had some good bread in your life today!
articles.title: endings and beginnings

articles.description:
I hate that lol you're nervous about something and someone tells you aw don't be nervous!
Or you're stressing over something and they scream at you to CALM THE FUCK DOWN!!
Oh okay! I didn't think about it that way! I'm so silly 🤪
For real though, one of the things about getting older is caring less about what people think. I used to think my dad looked so lame wearing 10 year old, $7 jeans from Walmart, generic black tennis shoes and a plain solid color tee shirt all the time like he's some kinda Seinfeld character. Meanwhile I was straightening my blonde emo-ver hair, wearing skin tight skinny jeans with a pink studded belt from Spencer's and walking around in loud, multicolor, just... massive tongued skating shoes.
These days, half the time I'm at work anyway so I'm wearing a long-sleev…
articles.title: Don't be embarrassed

articles.description:
Today, I realized that the past three days share something important and beautiful: community.
Today, the pride parade took place here in Stockholm. I met up with my mom, sister, her husband, and their kids, who had come to the city for the occasion. It was wonderful sharing the event with them.
Yesterday, I decided to return to Mastodon. I missed the community and created a new account (birming@social.lol). Thank you all for the warm welcome. You're amazing!
The day before yesterday, I decided to continue this blog. Since then, I've received wonderful feedback from you readers. It's made me happy, grateful, and motivated. Thank you all!
Three days, three different experiences, but one common thread: community. It's easy to overlook this invaluable aspect of life. However, when it's absent, we truly understand its significance.
So, dear friends, thank you for being part of my life.
articles.title: The Importance of Community

articles.description:
Seeing as how I don't practice gratitude nearly as much as I want to, I thought that I'd keep today's post short and list a bunch of things that I am grateful for in no particular order.
The chilly morning winter air
Being able to admire beautiful sunrise and sunsets
The colourful sound of bird calls
The feeling of serenity when I have a glass of tea in the early hours of the morning
The peace I feel whenever I sit down to write a post
Moments spent with loved ones
Sleeping in on the weekends
Tasty food
You, for reading this post!
I would love to hear what your "little things" are! Leave a message in my guest book or shoot me a message on the Blaugust discord.
3/31
articles.title: things i'm grateful for

articles.description:
I'm Valentine. As you've probably already guessed, that is not my real name. I like my (semi-)anonymity. I may be spilling my guts on here, but I'd like to do it under the cover of a good old pseudonym.
Like a lot of people, I've been using different names online for years. Obviously not to commit crimes, but to make it less likely I become a victim of one. Also, I just like it. Names fascinate me: they make up such a big part of our first impressions. I've tried feminine names and not-so-feminine ones. I've never tried a really masculine name, though—I've always loved being a woman, online and offline, even if it comes with many inconveniences of varying sizes.
I took Valentine from the Måneskin song of the same name. But if that's too somber for you, there's also the Laufey song, which i…
articles.title: becoming valentine

articles.description:
V landed in New York this week. I met him and Mom at his new studio apartment1 with the keys, which puts an end to my weeks of apartment tours. (Thank Frith...)
I think we were all pretty happy to see each other. Things haven't always been this way, so I'm grateful our relationships have improved as the years go by. One of the things I don't think gets talked about enough is how important (and difficult!) the task of forgiving your parents is. Of course nothing will undo what we saw, felt, and heard as kids but (most of) our parents were just trying their best. Aren't we all? I know I would want to be forgiven if I had tried my best, even if things didn't come out exactly as I'd hoped.
Predictably, Mom hates New York. It doesn't help that inexplicably, they chose a hotel a block away from …
articles.title: the strip mall of your dreams

articles.description:
I was supposed to do an Intro Post yesterday, but I’ve never been good at it so I delayed it until I could figure out what to say. Here we are a day later, and I still don’t quite have the words for it. I always fall back to a post I’ve written of not wanting to talk about myself as an explanation. Either way, I’ve come to realize that I never did do a proper introduction on this blog, outside of my About me page. In my defense, I think what I have written on there is enough to kind of get a gist for who I am.
But since I’m writing a post anyways, I figured I’d say something else that doesn’t completely repeat everything written on there.
Online, I typically go by JC(Probably), but most people in real life call me Jedda. You can tell a lot about how people know me, and from what moment in …
articles.title: I'm JC... Probably?

articles.description:
Being in my early 20s, there should be no surprise that I have grown up with and have extensively used social media platforms to socialise, communicate, and share ideas with other people. It is no secret that these platforms can and have caused harm to their user's mental health (me included!), but even knowing this I've sat on my hands for years before actually taking action to remedy this situation.
However, as a lot of you know, it's not easy to just drop social media cold turkey. In my opinion, I think there are a few main reasons why this is the case, and I will attempt to argue against each one in this post.
1. Social media is addictive
Multi-million dollar companies spend huge amounts of capital and time to create algorithms where their sole purpose is to make you spend more time on…
articles.title: on social media addiction

articles.description:
a social media channel is one thing, but it has multiple sub-things inside
look at youtube
there's the side where someone is always selling something
there's the side where a grandma is sharing her recipe
there's the side where someone just posted a video compilation of their dead love one
there's the side where someone is laughing with their friends
earlier this year, i was complaining that my feed was full of people selling me something
but your social media feed doesn't operate in a vacuum. it shows you more of what you look for
i wanted to sell something, so i was looking for people to teach me to sell something, so i was only being recommended videos of people teaching me to sell something
i don't like that side of the internet
so i left it
you can leave the side you're on and join another
or leave altogether
articles.title: your social media feed doesn't operate in a vacuum

articles.description:
From the same trip where I took the photo of Nemo in El Nido, Philippines.

August 2014, Philippines, GoPro Hero 3
Not a huge fan of how I edited this. It's too high-def for my taste now, but this is why I like posting these throwback photos because I get to see how my post-processing preferences have changed over the years. The sky is a bit blown out as well, but that may also be due to the original photo (that I don't have access to at the moment).
articles.title: Throwback Thursday 004 - El Nido Waters

articles.description:
Why write?
I have a ritual. Every time I set out to do something new, be it a new habit, a new course, or a new adventure in life, I ask myself, why? This exercise in setting a purpose is essential because it stays as a reminder of your initial vision about what you set out to do. So, as I launch this blog, I want to openly share the purpose and vision behind it.
This isn't just another hobby project for me. Ever since I was 13, I have wanted to write. To share my ideas with friends, aka people, across the world. There was even a time when I wanted to try to write a self help book, to understand the world and life in general, more effectively. I have always been enamoured by great ideas. For it is these great ideas, passed down from generation to generation, which have survived the test of…
articles.title: Why write?

articles.description:
Yesterday, I wrote that I had decided to end this blog. When I woke up this morning, I immediately realized that it was the wrong decision.
Crazy? Maybe.
But that’s how it sometimes is. You can’t always reason your way to the right decision. At least, I can’t. I’d been pondering this for weeks...
It was only when the idea became a reality that I realized it was a bad one. I wish I could avoid taking these detours in my decision-making process, but I’ve come to realize that will probably never happen.
And when you think about it, that “detour” is actually a shortcut to the right decision. Weeks of theoretical pondering didn’t help at all, while taking concrete action gave me an answer in a few hours.
Detours can be shortcuts, at least sometimes and for me. Sorry for the confusion — and welcome to my world. I hope you have the patience to stick around...
articles.title: The blog that refuses to die

articles.description:
one of my favorite things about people is their hobbies
i absolutely love watching people do the things they love doing, again and again
people who've turned a passion into mastery, who don't tire - they just show up over and over because of the love they have for their craft
it blows my mind
so i started to wonder: how do people find things they truly like?
i've been sitting with this question for a while now. i don't know if i've ever liked something well enough to stick to it long-term
my memory fails me (yes, i have shit memory at the ripe young age of my early 20's), but from what i can remember from my childhood, i loved reading, skating and writing
i remember reading Diary of a Wimpy Kid and Dork Diaries. my older sister and i created something that was an amalgamation of the two. i…
articles.title: how do people find things they like

articles.description:
I had the best small-town weekend again with K.
Country drives, flea market barn jaunts, dinner with his mom, double dog walks + cuddled-up binging our favorite show.

out-the-car-window farm gem
He took me to see his parent's house, where he grew up which he’s called home his entire life.
It's strange to witness someone have such an intimate connection to land and environment. The ease and pride as he recounts the tapestry of stories that make up his town. I envy his deep roots.
I've moved so many times that I've lost count of how many addresses I've held.
He said he wanted to share his roots with me. Might have been the most romantic thing anyone has ever said to me.

red rubber ball, Courtice, ON
On Sunday, he took me to the Courtice Flea Market, where I found two records that I immediately bought:

Tony Molina, Confront The Truth, 2016. Think: Weezer, The Beatles, with a dash of punk.

Cat Power, Moon Pix, 1998. What a breathtaking cover.
 ✧ you're my internet crush✧
•only two links today bc i've been frolicking in the wildflowers•



Garden of Love Tarot. This gorgeous deck is a burlesque take on the original Tarot de Marseilles. Yes pls.
Cassidy Williams's post about how hard it is to be paid for creative work filled me with over-brimming madness, frustration, and sadness. How do we change our perceptions of money?
heart eyes:
peach cobbler blizzard
Your dad's car by The Rills + Split lip by Delores Forever. Playback: infinity loop.
Heart spoons for stirring coffee
true-blue laughing with your head back
sensual hand massages
articles.title: floating in desire

articles.description:
Author: C. L. James
Title: Anarchy
Subtitle: A Tract for the Times
Date: 1886
Source: Retrieved on 2nd August 2024 from archive.org

 I claim credit for no originality on account of the pages which follow, except such as may be implied in putting together the discoveries of my predecessors so that they may support and illustrate each other better than this has been done previously. 
 Anarchy, from the Greek a or an (not) and arche (the first, the chief) or archon (a magistrate) means that state of society in which there is no government. It is, therefore, very improperly applied to that state in which there are two, or more, governments contending for the supremacy. What Anarchists desire, is the permanent abolition of all government. It is contended, and is doubtless true, that this would…
articles.title: C. L. James - Anarchy

articles.description:
Author: C. L. James
Title: Origin of Anarchism
Date: 1902
Source: Retrieved on 3rd August 2024 from archive.org

 Anarchism, it can hardly be necessary to say, is not a conspiracy for the assassination of kings and such-like. It is not an armed movement of the proletariat or of a part of them. It is not a secret organization. Notions of its nature such as people of information have abandoned to journalists, journalists to politicians, and politicians to Mr. Roosevelt, require no further refutation. Anarchism, whatever it may give rise to, can be described as a theory only. The thesis of Anarchism is that men govern men by deceiving them — a view never very unfamiliar to statesmen like Machiavelli, but which evidently assumes a somewhat novel complexion when preached to the people who are g…
articles.title: C. L. James - Origin of Anarchism

articles.description:
Author: Industrial Workers of the World
Title: Constitution of the Industrial Workers of the World
Date: January 1, 2022
Source: https://www.iww.org/constitution/

Preamble
 The working class and the employing class have nothing in common. 
 There can be no peace so long as hunger and want are found among millions of the working people and the few, who make up the employing class, have all the good things of life. 
 Between these two classes a struggle must go on until the workers of the world organise as a class, take possession of the means of production, abolish the wage system, and live in harmony with the earth. 
 We find that the centering of the management of industries into fewer and fewer hands makes the trade unions unable to cope with the evergrowing power of the employing class…
articles.title: Industrial Workers of the World - Constitution of the Industrial Workers of the World

articles.description:
Author: Julian Langer
Title: Enough! Dance!
Date: 18/7/24
Source: https://ecorevoltblog.wordpress.com/2024/07/18/enough-dance/

1
 The ghost of Turgenev crying 
 “Enough!” 
 Is in my ears 
 My activities are glorious 
 While several seasons 
 Fighting disease 
 Living closely with personal existential uncertainty 
 My body is marked 
 There is a thin line 
 Across my left eyelid 
 A scar from where it was removed 
 I am tired of this 
 There is a book 
 Being written 
 The first section poems like this 
 I wonder if it’s my last 
 I don’t know 
2
 All things are possible 
 So say Shestov and Fondane 
 Yes, all things are possible 
 Including the impossibility 
 Of my writing another book after this 
 Yes, all things are possible 
 What is most possible though 
 For all life 
 It seems is i…
articles.title: Julian Langer - Enough! Dance!

articles.description:
Author: Ignatius
Title: Fist Full of Concrete
Subtitle: Some Thoughts Towards Insurrection
Date: 2023
Notes: Published by Long Leaf Distro 2023 
 Longleaf_distro@protonmail.com 
 Reproduce to your heart’s content.
Source: Retrieved on 4 July 2023 from ia800301.us.archive.org/4/items/zines-anarchism/Fist_Full_of_Concrete-screen.pdf

It Doesn’t Have to Be This Way, You Know
 There is a beauty that creeps in under the plastic blinds, covering the window, in the form of sunlight. A beauty that seems an attempt by the world outside to draw some contrast to the words I write here, and that you will read later on. That for all the expression of pain, and dissatisfaction, and desire for more, there is still beauty to be found here, bouncing around the walls of this mold infested apartment. 
 This …
articles.title: Ignatius - Fist Full of Concrete

articles.description:
Author: Anonymous
Title: Ridin’ Dirty: A Basic Reference for Freight Hopping
Date: 07/20/2024
Source: https://warzonedistro.noblogs.org/post/2024/07/20/ridin-dirty-a-basic-reference-for-freight-hopping/

A Few Words From the Distro
 Riding freight is a core skill for anti-work, anti-school, individualist anarchists, lifestylists, nomads, oogles, crust punk dirty kids, and travelers. 
 Hate your job? Quit and go train hopping! 
 Sick of school? Drop out and go train hopping! 
 Feeling suicidal with no fun and excitement in your life? 
 Try something new, open a new chapter and go train hopping! 
 But train hopping is very dangerous! You SERIOUSLY could die. 
 But you could also die in a car wreck on the way to work, or die from getting shot to death by a mass shooter. 
 At the end of the da…
articles.title: Anonymous - Ridin’ Dirty: A Basic Reference for Freight Hopping

articles.description:
Author: Delfina Vannuci & Richard Singer
Title: Come Hell or High Water
Subtitle: A Handbook on Collective Process Gone Awry
Date: 2010
Notes: Originally published by AK Press. ISBN-13: 9781849350181,
Source: AK Press

PREFACE
 Welcome to the collective book on collective process! Over the course of the twenty or so years that AK Press has been publishing and distributing anarchist and radical literature, we've gotten a lot of requests for good, short overviews of topics that are of interest to the folks in our communities: anarchism, worker's rights, solidarity economics, and countless other things. We do our best to seek out books to publish or distribute that meet our readers’ needs, but it can take a while to find exactly the right author or book. One of the most common requests we get…

articles.description:
Author: Ichikawa Hakugen
Title: The Problem Of Buddhist Socialism in Japan
Date: 1970
Source: Retrieved on 7/31/24 from https://noselvesnomasters.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/ichikawa-hakugens.pdf

(1)
 The formation of Buddhist socialism in Japan made a belated start and its influence was little compared with that of Christian socialism in Europe, or even with the revolutionary movement (1851-1864) which occurred in the period of “idle peace” started by Hong Xiuquan (洪秀全) in China. The reason for the belated start seems to be indirectly concerned with national isolationism and the slow development of capitalism in Japan. The Communist Manifesto was published 20 years before the Meiji Restoration and the first volume of Das Kapital was issued a year before the Meiji Restoration. Directly…
articles.title: Ichikawa Hakugen - The Problem Of Buddhist Socialism in Japan

articles.description:
Author: Anonymous
Title: Hamas, anarchists in the West and Palestine solidarity
Subtitle: An analysis
Date: July 15th 2024
Notes: Anonymous author from Stoking the Embers Collective
Source: Retrieved on August 1, 2024 from https://libcom.org/article/hamas-anarchists-west-and-palestine-solidarity-analysis

 In the West, it is practically impossible to speak publicly about Hamas in any way that isn't an outright and total condemnation. Behind such remarkable limitation of the spectrum of public debate lies the idea that Hamas represents an "evil" so deep that it lacks any complexity. In parliaments, universities and newspapers, Hamas is never discussed, simply because -- it is assumed -- there is nothing to discuss. The idea that Hamas is simply a "terrorist" group that wants nothing but dea…
articles.title: Anonymous - Hamas, anarchists in the West and Palestine solidarity

Title: On Why Dr John Drury Is A Collaborationist Asshole
Subtitle: A Review of Cop-Out: The Significance of Aufhebengate
Date: 2013, May
Source: Retrieved on July 29, 2021 from <theanvilreview.org/print/aufhebengate>

 On many levels it seems almost pointless to write yet another text on Aufhebengate, especially a review about a book on the scandal and the controversies and collaboration-sympathizing that occurred in the vain, and inexplicable, attempt to defend John Drury from his own actions. Usually interpersonal issues point more to the poverty of the militancy and viability of certain circles of so-called “radical scenes” than anything of consequence. In these cases I would usually not waste my time writing a critique of a second-rate academic who writes for a gener…

articles.description:
Author: Liao
Title: A Catalyst for Fascist Reaction
Date: 7/20/2024
Source: https://www.thecommoner.org.uk/a-catalyst-for-fascist-reaction/

 The fallout from the attempted assassination on United States presidential candidate, Donald J. Trump, will bring an increase in fascist propaganda and reactionary attitudes, while also having serious societal repercussions for marginalized groups and political dissidents. While anarchists typically, and rightfully, disparage engagement in electoral politics, the occurrence of this event will likely have effects far beyond just the 2024 United States election. The main focus of this article is to engage with the likely fallout and effects of such an assassination attempt, rather than discuss the actuality of the attempt in a substantive manner. 
 Lik…
articles.title: Liao - A Catalyst for Fascist Reaction

sources.title: Stories by Alibaba Cloud on Medium
